content: Singaporean barrister and arbitrator **Michael Hwang** [SC](/wiki/Senior_Counsel) is a Singaporean lawyer and [arbitrator](/wiki/Arbitrator). In 1991, he was appointed [Judicial Commissioner](/wiki/Judicial_Commissioner) of the [Supreme Court of Singapore](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Singapore). He completed his term in 1992, and in 1997 he was appointed one of the first eight [Senior Counsel](/wiki/Senior_counsel) in Singapore. From 2008 to 2010, he was the President of the Law Society of Singapore. In 2010, he became the Chief Justice of the [Dubai International Financial Centre](/wiki/Dubai_International_Financial_Centre) [Courts](/wiki/DIFC_Courts). In 2014, he was awarded the [Pierre de Coubertin Medal](/wiki/Pierre_de_Coubertin_Medal) by the [International Olympic Committee](/wiki/International_Olympic_Committee) for his work with the International Council of Arbitration for Sports, which operates the [Court of Arbitration for Sport](/wiki/Court_of_Arbitration_for_Sport). This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This Asian law-related biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
title: Michael Hwang
